text: <@U1GEAC401>: we need to check out the stacktrace & check the line number 16, its not very difficult to debug xml as well.

things which generally cause crashes in XML are 
1) invalid keys like using “class" instead of “android:name"
2) Missing resources in default folders (Example: only putting image in drawable-xxhdpi would crash on lower end devices)
3) When overriding custom views if u don’t override all constructors it would crash

random? just like a normal recyclerview. data is determined by whatever you feed into your adapter

Hey I’m learning Docker and getting ready to create a build image for doing android builds. Anyone have a public docker image they would recommend?
<@U0DC95VCP>: I'm working on something regarding docker images. I can spin one up for you tomorrow. (1AM atm)
I'm gonna make my own probably in the future for my own needs
All of the docker files will probably be up somewhere
yeah i was looking at the jacekmarchwicki one…is that what you would recommend?
I haven't used Docker for Android yet
I’m just looking for a place to start, but will likely do the same. Easier to maintain.
Yeah I’m a complete newb to it altogether. Pretty friggin cool tho
I also don't really see a need for Docker for Android
What do you need it for?
If they had the same tools available to me back in 2003 that are available today - I may have stayed in SysOps much longer.
You could say the same for all of the other stuff :stuck_out_tongue:
Automated build processes. We are going 100% automated - so nightly builds will be kicked off using this container - as well as any on-demand builds.
I guess at the end of the day it’s much cheaper than keeping a server up for builds
Ah, I thought most CI software had prebuilt stuff so you wouldn't have to bother with Docker
If you still want me to look into Android specifically
I can do so tomorrow probably
We were using Jenkins, but now we’ve switched to “Go” which I had never heard of before and kept thinking they were talking about “Go” the language.
oh no worries…I just wanted to get some recommendations. Android build machines are already pretty simple.
I’m sure I can take this one image and play with it and learn.
i imagine it's impossible to search for go language stuff :confused:
ah…I guess golang would make sense
<@U0DC95VCP>: can you tell me how the docker image works out for you btw after?

<@U061HDV96>: if I create a docker image that is utilizing the latest android SDK and 2 months from now a new SDK is released, does that mean I need to build a new image? I’m guessing yes, with what I understand so far, but I want to check my logic.
<@U0DC95VCP>: ya. Docker images are basically layers on top of layers.
So you'll want a new image
It won't have to build the other images anymore.
And the whole image is smaller than the memory AS uses :troll:
